div.div: Linden Street School, 69 Linden St, Plainville, CT 06062, USA

a.aria-label: See All News

div.div: In the spirit of Frank T. Wheeler Elementary School's Kindness Campaign, School Recess Monitor Staci Monzillo is spreading kindness during school vacation week by dropping beautifully decorated kindness rocks randomly throughout five neighborhoods in Plainville.

a.aria-label: Read more about Kindness Rocks!

a.data-lightbox: Custodial Manager Scott Martin and Plainville High School Custodian Marty Brennan load Domino's pizzas donated for Facilities Department and Food Service Department employees.

img.alt: Custodial Manager Scott Martin and Plainville High School Custodian Marty Brennan load Domino's pizzas donated for Facilities Department and Food Service Department employees.

div.h3: Domino's Donates Pizzas to Facilities and Food Service Staff
div.div: Plainville Domino's Pizza owner Shovon Issa recently donated pizzas to every Plainville Community School' Facilities Department and Food Service Department employee to support them and their hard work in the school district during the district's shutdown.

a.aria-label: Read more about Domino's Donates Pizzas to Facilities and Food Service Staff

div.h3: "Space in the Community" Program Held at Middle School of Plainville
div.div: On March 13th, retired NASA Astronaut Corps member Duane Digger Carey, together with educators from the Space Foundation and representatives from the Petit Family Foundation, visited the Middle School of Plainville to share the Space in the Community program.

a.aria-label: Read more about "Space in the Community" Program Held at Middle School of Plainville

div.h3: Plainville Board of Education Receives CABE Communications Awards
div.div: The Plainville Board of Education received four first place Connecticut Association of Boards of Education ( CABE) Bonnie B. Carney Communications Awards of Excellence at the March 9th Plainville Board of Education Meeting.

a.aria-label: Read more about Plainville Board of Education Receives CABE Communications Awards

div.div: Plainville Community Schools volunteer Mentors and student Mentees recently enjoyed a "Magical Evening with Cyril the Sorcerer" to celebrate their annual Mentor Fun Night.

a.aria-label: Read more about Mentor Fun Night!

a.data-lightbox: Conn Men Acapella Group at MSP

img.alt: Conn Men Acapella Group at MSP

div.div: On March 6, 2020 the University of Connecticut's premier acapella group "Conn Men" visited the Middle School of Plainville to present a concert to the student body.

a.aria-label: Read more about Acapella Group Visits MSP

div.h3: Plainville Community Schools Kindergarten Registration Information
div.div: Children who will be five (5) years old on or before January 1, 2021 are eligible for kindergarten (full day program) in September, 2020.

a.aria-label: Read more about Plainville Community Schools Kindergarten Registration Information

div.div: Students, staff and visitors celebrated Read Across America during the first week of March.

a.aria-label: Read more about Read Across America 2020!

a.data-lightbox: Commissioner of Education Dr. Miguel Cardona addresses attendees at the Teacher Leader Fellowship Program Institute held at Plainville High School on February 27th.

img.alt: Commissioner of Education Dr. Miguel Cardona addresses attendees at the Teacher Leader Fellowship Program Institute held at Plainville High School on February 27th.

div.h3: PCS Hosts Teacher Leader Fellowship Program Institute
div.div: On February 27th members of the Central Connecticut State Universitys Teacher Leader Fellowship Program, under the direction of Dr. Betty Sternberg, gathered at Plainville High School for a meeting and several break out sessions.

a.aria-label: Read more about PCS Hosts Teacher Leader Fellowship Program Institute

div.h3: District Preschool Registration Information for the 2020-2021 School Year
div.div: The Plainville Community Schools Preschool Program will begin accepting registrations on Monday, March 16, 2020.

a.aria-label: Read more about District Preschool Registration Information for the 2020-2021 School Year

div.h3: Annual Unified Basketball Game a Good Time for All!
div.div: The Plainville Community Schools 4th Annual Unified Basketball Team versus Administrators, Board Of Education Members, Faculty, and Parents game was held on February 20th at Plainville High School.

a.aria-label: Read more about Annual Unified Basketball Game a Good Time for All!

div.div: Plainville High School art students Alexia Sirois and Abigail Feyerabend were recently recognized with Connecticut Regional Scholastic Art Awards.

a.aria-label: Read more about PHS Students Receive Art Awards

div.p: Plainville High School Counselor Kelly Hickey was recognized as the school districts Everyday Hero for the month of April. Kelly was nominated by the Mandeville Family for her outstanding dedication to students and extra efforts to make a difference. She was honored virtually during the April 20th Plainville Board of Education meeting.

h2.style: font-size: 30px; text-transform: uppercase; color: rgb(248, 248, 250); background-color: rgb(178, 50, 50);

span.style: display: block; padding: 1em 0px; font-style: italic; font-size: 0.8em; background-color: rgb(178, 50, 50); color: rgb(248, 248, 250);

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; color: rgb(248, 248, 250); font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(178, 50, 50);

div.p: Welcome to the Superintendents Spotlight! In this section, Mr. LePage will highlight (via video) a variety of programs, initiatives, and projects happening throughout Plainville Community Schools.

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; color: rgb(248, 248, 250); font-size: 16px; background-color: rgb(178, 50, 50);

div.p:
Happy New Year!
Plainville Community Schools welcomed students back for the 2019-2020 school year on Tuesday, September 3rd! Check out Louis Toffolon Elementary Schools Aloha Together themed welcome back video!

a.aria-label: Return to Homepage

strong.i: Plainville Community Schools inspire and prepare lifelong learners to follow their passion, engage in their communities, and positively impact our global society.
